column4: how do I reinstall breezy? something is very obviously wrong with my install >.<
you can reinstall the same way you installed, but it really ought not to be necessary
I installed with apt-get is there a reinstall command?
you upgraded from hoary?
yes
what isn't working?
specifics..."I do X, Y should happen, instead Z happens"
I turn on my ubuntu box, I should boot into X, I don't
do you get anything on the screen at all? can you log into a console?
lt boots to a shell prompt
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
/etc/init.d/gdm start
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
that returns me to a shell prompt
did you do apt-get dist-upgrade?
yes
yes you did
can you put your sources.list on a pastebin somewhere?
if you have net access on it, and you've fixed the sources.list file now
you might want to apt-get remove the X stuff, then reinstall it
rather than reinstalling the whole lot
how do I remove the X stuff, I mean how do I know which ones are X related?
apt-get remove xserver-xorg and similar stuff
you still have no X?
